intro: Mnesithea merguensis, commonly known as the Merguensis mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Mnesithea merguensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
